item.description:
This hike and social is designed for those who enjoy smaller groups and who have a lot of leisurely time to spend outside, without a day end deadline.

The focus of this hike will be enjoying the wildlife, in particular the birds around us. We will leave at 9:10. The hike and picnic lunch will be a minimum of 3 hours, but could go substantially longer depending on how people are feeling. We will probably hike anywhere from 2.5 to 3.5 miles.

Please bring along your camera, binoculars and bug spray. We spotted baby kingbirds and baby tufted titmouses here.

Here is the link to the Ipswich River Wildlife Sanctuary:
http://www.massaudubo...

The directions on the web site are fine; the only thing being that you have to look carefully for a very small white sign on the turn off Route 97 - and again for the turn into the wildlife center, which is about another mile or so after you make that turn. The address is 87 Perkins Row (not Perkins Lane).
If you like, you can also print out a trail map in advance from the above website.

Please note that the sanctuary does charge a $4 per person entrance fee. There are restrooms on site.

I look forward to meeting some of you and seeing some of you again!

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Birding walk at Ipswich River- slow with many stops- with Picnic Lunch
